mamaPajama
Class MamaPajama

java.lang.Object
  mamaPajama.MamaPajama

public class MamaPajama
extends Object

MamaPajama is a collection of often used functions

Author:
Noa Younse

Method Detail

begin

public static void begin(PApplet parent_)
Required to use functions in MamaPajama

Parameters:
parent_ - Needed to set the overall Processing parent

drawGrid

public static void drawGrid(float gridExtents,
                            float gridSize)
Will draw a grid on the XY plane using the default color

Parameters:
gridExtents - How far to make the grid in both directions
gridSize - How many units each grid will be

drawGrid

public static void drawGrid(float gridExtents,
                            float gridSize,
                            int baseColor)
Will draw a grid on the XY plane

Parameters:
gridExtents - How far to make the grid in both directions
gridSize - How many units each grid will be
baseColor - The base color for the grid [excluding the alpha]

drawOrigin

public static void drawOrigin()
This will draw some lines at the origin. Red for X axis, Green for Y axis, and Blue for Z axis. The longer side indicates the positive direction

isInsidePolygon

public static boolean isInsidePolygon(PVector pos,
                                      PVector[] verticesIn)
Checks whether a PVector lies within the bounds of a outline defined by an array of PVectors

Parameters:
pos - A PVector that is to be tested
verticesIn - The PVector[] that defines the planar polygon
Returns:
true if the PVector is in the outline

printStatus

public static void printStatus()
Will printStatus with defaults

printStatus

public static void printStatus(String functionName)
Will printStatus with a functionName and the defaults

Parameters:
functionName - A String used for organizing the code. Just prints out the name

printStatus

public static void printStatus(String functionName,
                               String notes)
Will printStatus with a functionName, Notes, and the defaults - free & total memory (divided by 100000), frameRate, frameCount, and the last few stack trace elements

Parameters:
functionName - A String used for organizing the code. Just prints out the name
notes - A String used for a manual description

splitStringIntoLines

public static String[] splitStringIntoLines(String stringIn,
                                            float lineWidthIn,
                                            PFont fontIn)
This will take in a String and split it up into a String[] according to the maximum width specified. Note: Don't use the special characters, » (option+9) and ¦ (option+7) in the text. Also note: if a single word is too long this will NOT break it up.. aka it will extend beyond the lineWidthIn

Parameters:
stringIn - The single String that will be split up
lineWidthIn - The maximum width, in pixels, for each line
fontIn - The Processing font that will be used to determine the line widths
Returns:
The String[] of the broken up line

rotateXYZ

public static PVector rotateXYZ(PVector ptIn,
                                PVector originIn,
                                double rotX,
                                double rotY,
                                double rotZ)
This will rotate a point around an origin point in the x, y, and z

Parameters:
ptIn - The original point
originIn - The origin point to rotate around
rotX - How much to rotate around the x axis
rotY - How much to rotate around the y axis
rotZ - How much to rotate around the z axis
Returns:
The resultant PVector

rotate3d

public static PVector rotate3d(PVector segmentStart,
                               PVector segmentEnd,
                               float angle,
                               PVector ptIn)
This will rotate a PVector around an axis for a given amount

Parameters:
segmentStart - PVector of the start of the segment
segmentEnd - PVector of the end of the segment
angle - The angle of rotation from the original point around the segment axis
ptIn - The original point to be rotated around the axis
Returns:
PVector of the resultant rotation

drawPoint

public static void drawPoint(PVector p,
                             float length)
This will draw a little cross thing at a point location

Parameters:
p - The PVector point to be drawn
length - The overall length of the line that will represent the point

drawSegment

public static void drawSegment(PVector segmentTop,
                               PVector segmentBottom,
                               float extendAmount,
                               boolean drawPoints)
This will draw a line between two points, and optionally draw the points too

Parameters:
segmentTop - The top of the segment
segmentBottom - The bottom of the segment
extendAmount - How much, if any, to extend the segment
drawPoints - Whether or not to draw the points at the end of the segment. Default point size will be the extendAmount / 2 or 5, whichever is bigger
